By Thorr on Wednesday, October 10, 2007 - 06:33 am:

Looking in the same picture -

The blue boxed text says Battle chotto Real. Chotto means 'in a little while' or 'shortly'.

Looking at the menu, there are 10 items. I will list the ones I can figure out -

01) Status
02) (unsure, but looks like it could be an inventory of some sort)
03) Item
04) Skill/Technique
05) Emotion
06) Quest
07) Party? (paatei)
08) Grade? (giredo)
09) Friend
10) System

By Thorr on Wednesday, October 10, 2007 - 07:02 am:

By Thorr on Wednesday, October 10, 2007 - 07:18 am:

I think this is a battle screen now that I look at it more..

The yellow text in the upper box seems to indicate that you are 'learning about the enemy'.

If you look at the ground around the Mew, he is the center of a target. These color bands would tell me that those are the 3 ranges for attack - Green = Far, Yellow = mid, Red = close.

Also, in the lower right area, there are techniques listed along with their ranges. Lisa's character is obviously there to coach her monster. The Mew Doll may be a stray monster without a trainer.

Just my thoughts based on what I see.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, October 10, 2007 - 09:17 am:

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, October 10, 2007 - 04:49 pm:

It's entirely in Japanese, and currently being tested for a few hours a month in the middle of the night. If you're familiar with playing the MR games in Japanese, you'll do ok, as long as the 3am-7am hours don't do you in.
